Each PIU is required to maintain two sets of books of accounts, one for NHAI (for payment of salaries, etc , and to meet expenses on pre- construction activities) and the other for SPV. After the award of the contracts, these PIUs handle payments in respect of the works implemented by the SPVs: 2_ With a view to avoid duplicacy in maintenance of the books of accounts, it has been decided to follow the procedures prescribed as under- These PIUs shall not maintain separate books of accounts for NHAI. may maintain the books 0f accounts only of SPVs and incur all expenses At the year-end, all the expenses attributable to NHAI may be recovered from NHAI by the respective SPVs (iii) As regards the salary and other establishment expenses, NHAI shall bear 75% of the yearly establishment expenses and the balance 25% shall be borne by the respective SPVs. (iv) Where the   SPV is yet to Start its   operations, initially  NHAI may maintain the books of accounts and incur all expenses  Once the SPV starts its operations, the PIU may close the NHAI's books of accounts and maintain the SPV's books of accounts and incur all expenses  The SPVs may assess their manpower requirements for PIUs. 3.
